meanings.definition: A person who is habitually gloomy or sullen.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor is always a sourpuss, never smiling or laughing.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street is known as a sourpuss because he rarely talks to anyone.
meanings.sent3: Even though he won the lottery, he still acted like a sourpuss at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her sourpuss demeanor cast a shadow over the cheerful gathering.
meanings.sent5: The image of a sourpuss face stuck in my mind long after I saw it.

meanings.definition: A facial expression showing displeasure or discontent.
meanings.sent1: When I told him the news, he made a sourpuss face.
meanings.sent2: The child's sourpuss expression indicated that he didn't like the taste of the food.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't hide her sourpuss look when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The sourpuss on her face made it clear she was not enjoying the movie.
meanings.sent5: His sourpuss expression made everyone wonder what had upset him.
